block.p: Hong Jin Lee, a daughter of Sang Dae Lee and Back Sup of Oak Park, Ill., was married yesterday to John Dyer Wentz, the son of Sally A. Allen of Wynnewood, Pa., and Frederic Mann Wentz of Gladwyn, Pa. The Rev. Dr. William V. Arnold, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at Bryn Mawr Presbyterian Church in Bryn Mawr, Pa.
The bride and bridegroom are graduates of the Pratt Institute, where they met.

Hong Jin Lee, a daughter of Sang Dae Lee and Back Sup of Oak Park, Ill., was married yesterday to John Dyer Wentz, the son of Sally A. Allen of Wynnewood, Pa., and Frederic Mann Wentz of Gladwyn, Pa. The Rev. Dr. William V. Arnold, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at Bryn Mawr Presbyterian Church in Bryn Mawr, Pa.
The bride and bridegroom are graduates of the Pratt Institute, where they met.

Ms. Lee, 30, is keeping her name. She is a Web site producer for the Democratic National Committee in Washington. The bride received a master's degree in political science from Columbia University. Her parents own Swan Cleaners, a dry-cleaning business in Oak Park, Ill.

Mr. Wentz, 32, is the chief executive and a founding partner of Grey Pilgrim, a Rockville, Md., company that designs and manufactures remote-control robots for nuclear, marine and aerospace uses. The bridegroom's mother is a clinical psychologist and the clinical director and founder of Rosemont Counseling Associates in Rosemont, Pa. His father is a senior partner in McGrory, Wentz, Fernandez & O'Hara, a law firm in Norristown, Pa.
